We are pleased to announce the Madeira Board of Education has approved the hiring of Mr. Chris Flanagan as Madeira Elementary School Principal for next school year. Mr. Flanagan, who has a passion for helping students succeed, comes to Madeira with 10 years of elementary school teaching experience and six years in administration at the elementary level. Chris is currently serving as Principal of Ayer Elementary School in Forest Hills.

In both the staff and parent focus groups, key characteristics identified in our next leader included a strong understanding of elementary school curriculum and student development, the ability to understand our small-town Madeira experience, and strength in building relationships with students, staff, and parents. We believe Chris has these attributes and will be a good addition to Madeira.

In early August there will be a "Meet the Principal" reception for students and parents. In the meantime, let's extend a warm Madeira welcome to Chris Flanagan!

For more information, please visit our district website www.madeiracityschools.org.

New flags from twenty-one different nations have been hung in each of our three schools to represent the countries where all current Madeira Schools' students were born. Superintendent Steve Kramer stated, "The flags serve as a visible reminder of our diversity. Students have pointed out their country's flag to their peers, which has sparked conversations about customs and traditions that might not otherwise occur during lunchtime at school."

The countries represented are: Belgium, Brazil, Cambodia, China, Costa Rica, England, Ethiopia, France, Greece, Guatemala, India, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Puerto Rico, Russia, South Korea, Switzerland, Thailand, USA and Venezuela. New flags will be added when students born in any additional countries attend our district.

Signs will be hung in each building to explain the flags' significance.

Thank you to the Madeira Elementary School PTO, the Madeira Middle School PTO, and the Madeira High School PTO for these multi-national displays!
